What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness. Shows like the Big Bang Theory does it in taste without taking it to far.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness. Shows like the Big Bang Theory does it in taste without taking it to far. What I mean is that there are some shows where it is obvious they are stereotyping someone for the sake of cheap laughs, but no one in the real world is really like that for the most part.

I normally avoid shows and movies that play it's main characters like that, because I do not feel it is right.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness. Shows like the Big Bang Theory does it in taste without taking it to far. What I mean is that there are some shows where it is obvious they are stereotyping someone for the sake of cheap laughs, but no one in the real world is really like that for the most part.

I normally avoid shows and movies that play it's main characters like that, because I do not feel it is right. The people who are hurt by them are the ones that deal with it in real life.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness. Shows like the Big Bang Theory does it in taste without taking it to far. What I mean is that there are some shows where it is obvious they are stereotyping someone for the sake of cheap laughs, but no one in the real world is really like that for the most part.

I normally avoid shows and movies that play it's main characters like that, because I do not feel it is right. The people who are hurt by them are the ones that deal with it in real life. People watch those shows, then treat the people they know in real life badly because they think it is ok, when it is totally not ok.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, one of the most stereo typical characters that made me cringe was Steve Erkel. I think some of the cheap laughs that the writers and producers were going for fell flat and made him into a very annoying character that I literally groaned. They tried to portray him as the classic stereo typical nerd. With big glasses always falling off his face, suspenders, pocket protector, lanky, and socially awkward. It bothered me because it was terrible writing, bad comedy, and full on negative stereotypes. They tried to make it seem like anyone that was a "nerd" was socially inept, walking around looking stupid while being smart. The comedy was bad also.

Normally I would not mind stereo types in a TV show, as long as it is used in good taste unlike my example I just talked about. The use of stereo typical character types also makes me cringe especially when it is done without any awareness. Shows like the Big Bang Theory does it in taste without taking it to far. What I mean is that there are some shows where it is obvious they are stereotyping someone for the sake of cheap laughs, but no one in the real world is really like that for the most part.

I normally avoid shows and movies that play it's main characters like that, because I do not feel it is right. The people who are hurt by them are the ones that deal with it in real life. People watch those shows, then treat the people they know in real life badly because they think it is ok, when it is totally not ok. It is something that has been happening for a long time and needs to stop.
